channel.title: I need help please
channel.description: Hi, I was trying to remove useless stuff from my client.java, I just removed a few commands and compiled and got an error. I searched all over, cant fix it, my backup is form along time ago so I don't want to recode all that. [code]client.java:13347: illegal start of expression public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {[/code] I replaced most of the stuff i erased to try to fix it, but I can't get that one to go away. If anyone knows what might cause it, please let me know. I got 1 error. Thanks

item.title: I need help please
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

[code]Np. But the spaces don’t matter. You could have this:

if (requirement = true)
{

sendMessage("…");

}[/code]
It would work.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help please
item.dc:creator: @blakeblake blakeblake
item.description:
@blakeblake wrote:

Wow, i had 2 brackets and a space like this:

[code] PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+ " says… " +command.substring(5);
}
}

public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
	if (amount > 0) {[/code]

And I added one more and it fixed it. It works on my backup with 2 there, but 3 fixed it, so thank you very much guys

Read full topic

item.title: I need help please
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Notepad ++ - from what I hear - lines up brackets.
Add a closing bracket above that method.

Read full topic

is there a scripting tool i can use to find the error? I didn’t miss any brackets, i even replaced the entire method from my backup. Still got error.

item.title: I need help please

item.description:
@blakeblake wrote:

Hi, I was trying to remove useless stuff from my client.java, I just removed a few commands and compiled and got an error. I searched all over, cant fix it, my backup is form along time ago so I don’t want to recode all that.

client.java:13347: illegal start of expression public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
I replaced most of the stuff i erased to try to fix it, but I can’t get that one to go away. If anyone knows what might cause it, please let me know. I got 1 error. Thanks
